intro: Triadenia russeggeri, commonly known as the rock melon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and lobed leaves, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its flowers are typically yellow with five petals, and it produces edible fruits that are green when unripe and turn orange when mature. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
